Description: Detects users who must change their password before logging into AVD. Triggers when a user's password policy requires a mandatory change.
Detects user accounts that are locked out due to failed login attempts. Indicates potential security issues or users needing assistance.
Detects when a personal desktop VM fails to start for a connection attempt. May indicate VM configuration issues or Azure capacity problems.
Detects users attempting to connect with expired passwords. Users must reset their password before accessing AVD.
Detects connection attempts from disabled user accounts. Indicates terminated users trying to access AVD or account provisioning issues.
Detects when no healthy session hosts are available in a host pool. Critical issue preventing all user connections - requires immediate attention.
Detects file sharing violations during user profile loading or application access. Often related to FSLogix profile conflicts or locked files.
Detects failed user logon attempts to AVD session hosts. May indicate authentication issues, incorrect credentials, or account problems.
Detects when FSLogix profile unload is delayed waiting for user action. User may have unsaved work or active processes blocking logoff.
Detects unauthorized connection attempts to AVD. User lacks permissions on the application group or workspace.
Detects connection attempts when user has no personal desktop assigned. Occurs in personal host pools without desktop assignment.
Detects when client connects too late and reverse connection is already closed. May indicate network latency or timeout issues.
Detects errors initializing input device handles. May indicate driver issues or peripheral compatibility problems.
Detects when graphics capabilities are not received during session initialization. May indicate GPU or graphics driver issues.
Detects invalid or expired authentication tokens. Indicates authentication token validation failures or token expiration issues.
Detects login attempts with invalid credentials (wrong username or password). Indicates user credential issues or potential security concerns.
Detects when requested logon type is not granted by policy. User may lack required logon rights or policy restrictions are in place.
Detects users not authorized for logon. May indicate missing logon permissions or policy restrictions preventing access.
Detects session hosts running out of memory. Critical issue requiring immediate attention - may cause session crashes or prevent new connections.
Detects when session host resources are unavailable. May indicate capacity issues, host health problems, or resource exhaustion.
